newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bolsa seen stable and calm due holiday.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bolsa seen stable and calm due holiday.

text.p: Argentine stocks were expected to open stable Friday in a very dull market due to a national holiday Monday, dealers said.
"The market will be very calm today ahead of the holiday," said Augusto Milou, of Galicia Valores brokers. "Major dealers will remain at the sidelines until Tuesday."

Dealers said the market was in the middle of a downward correction after reaching recently its highest levels in five years. But the correction will be shortlived as the economy's fundamentals are strong.
"The underlying trend is bullish," a local bank dealer said. "After this correction the market may be testing new highs in the near future."

Expectations of a growing GDP add to positive corporate announcements like good Q4 earnings reported Thursday by steelmaker Siderca. Also, a consortium led by a controlled firm of holding Comercial del Plata Friday won a contract to operate an oil field in Venezuela.
